qas.question: When did the first wave of Humanism reach Europe?

answers.text: Middle Ages and the Early Modern period

qas.question: Who was thought to be the original believer of humanism in of the Renaissance period?
The study and following of classical writers was said to be a solution to what issue?

plausible_answers.text: Middle Ages and the Early Modern period

qas.question: When did the first wave of Humanism fail to reach Europe?
Who was thought to be the only believer of humanism in of the Renaissance period?
What issue was the study and following of classical writers said to be a problem of?
What was an intellectual movement forbidden in Europe?

context: <b7_0>Renaissance humanism<b7_0/> was an intellectual movement in Europe of the later <a0_0><b3_0>Middle Ages and the Early Modern period<b3_0/><a0_0/>. The 19th-century German historian Georg Voigt (1827–91) identified <a1_0><b4_0>Petrarch<b4_0/><a1_0/> as the first Renaissance humanist. Paul Johnson agrees that Petrarch was "the first to put into words the notion that the centuries between the fall of Rome and the present had been the <b5_0>age of Darkness<b5_0/>". According to Petrarch, what was needed to remedy this situation was the careful study and imitation of the great classical authors. For Petrarch and Boccaccio, the greatest master was <a2_0><b6_0>Cicero<b6_0/><a2_0/>, whose prose became the model for both learned (Latin) and vernacular (Italian) prose.
